org.elasticsearch.index

Class IndexModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.elasticsearch.index.IndexModule

  • public final class IndexModule
extends java.lang.Object
    IndexModule represents the central extension point for index level custom implementations like:
    • SimilarityProvider - New SimilarityProvider implementations can be registered through addSimilarity(String, BiFunction) while existing Providers can be referenced through Settings under the SIMILARITY_SETTINGS_PREFIX prefix along with the "type" value. For example, to reference the BM25SimilarityProvider, the configuration "index.similarity.my_similarity.type : "BM25" can be used.
    • IndexStore - Custom IndexStore instances can be registered via addIndexStore(String, BiFunction)
    • IndexEventListener - Custom IndexEventListener instances can be registered via addIndexEventListener(IndexEventListener)
    • Settings update listener - Custom settings update listener can be registered via addIndexSettingsListener(Consumer)

      • addIndexEventListener

        public void addIndexEventListener(IndexEventListener listener)
        Adds an IndexEventListener for this index. All listeners added here are maintained for the entire index lifecycle on this node. Once an index is closed or deleted these listeners go out of scope.

        Note: an index might be created on a node multiple times. For instance if the last shard from an index is relocated to another node the internal representation will be destroyed which includes the registered listeners. Once the node holds at least one shard of an index all modules are reloaded and listeners are registered again. Listeners can't be unregistered they will stay alive for the entire time the index is allocated on a node.

      • addIndexStore

        public void addIndexStore(java.lang.String type,
                          java.util.function.BiFunction<IndexSettings,IndexStoreConfig,IndexStore> provider)
        Adds an IndexStore type to this index module. Typically stores are registered with a refrence to it's constructor: 
             indexModule.addIndexStore("my_store_type", MyStore::new);
        Parameters:
        type - the type to register
        provider - the instance provider / factory method

      • addSimilarity

        public void addSimilarity(java.lang.String name,
                          java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.String,Settings,SimilarityProvider> similarity)
        Registers the given SimilarityProvider with the given name
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the SimilarityProvider
        similarity - SimilarityProvider to register

      • registerQueryCache

        public void registerQueryCache(java.lang.String name,
                               java.util.function.BiFunction<IndexSettings,IndicesQueryCache,QueryCache> provider)
        Registers a QueryCache provider for a given name
        Parameters:
        name - the providers / caches name
        provider - the provider instance

      • setSearcherWrapper

        public void setSearcherWrapper(IndexModule.IndexSearcherWrapperFactory indexSearcherWrapperFactory)
        Sets a IndexModule.IndexSearcherWrapperFactory that is called once the IndexService is fully constructed. Note: this method can only be called once per index. Multiple wrappers are not supported.
